intro: Pentace sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran pentace, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
